index.md.Il faut bien veiller à garder le module: Care must be taken to keep the module awake if it is on battery
index.md.Mon module vide ses batteries très vite: My module drains its batteries very quickly
index.md.Vérifiez que vous etes bien sur un firmw: Check that you are on an up-to-date firmware on your zigbee key
index.md.Dans 90% des cas une consommation excess: In 90% of cases, excessive battery consumption comes from the firmware of the key which has a problem
index.md.Vous avez deja beaucoup de module et ave: You already have a lot of mods and have exceeded the limit of the number of live mods (31 in general
index.md.Il faut soit mettre une autre clef Zigbe: You must either put another Zigbee key (the plugin manages up to 3) or try adding router nodes (be careful there is no clear standard on router nodes so there are incompatibilities between manufacturers
index.md.essayez de debrancher la clef pendant 2: try to unplug the key for 2 minutes, put it back and restart the daemon, it's a known disease of the Conbee key (even under deconz) or you need a cold reboot for the inclusion to work
index.md.Vous avez un SSD branché en USB3, essaye: You have an SSD plugged into USB3, try plugging it into a USB2 port
index.md.Je vois dans les logs des erreurs \"No c: I see "No cluster ID" errors in the logs
index.md.Il s'agit d'une inclusion incomplete il: This is an incomplete inclusion, you have to remove the module from the zigbee networks (using the zigbee networks button => Nodes), reset the module then re-include it, being careful to keep it awake during all the processes of the 'inclusion
index.md.Ma commande de capteur de mouvement\/d'o: My motion sensor / opening / switch command always remains at 1
index.md.C'est courant en zigbee le module envoi: It is common in zigbee mode the module sends the value one during an action (movement, opening, pressing the button) but does not return 0 when it is finished (end of movement for example
index.md.Vous pouvez mettre en place un retour d': You can set up a status return to 0 after 1min (for example) in the configuration of the equipment command tab then on the command line in question
index.md.J'ai pas autant de commande que de bouto: I don't have as many commands as buttons on my remote
index.md.Sur ma télécommande j'ai par exemple 2 b: On my remote control I have for example 2 buttons but in the list of Jeedom commands I only have 1 command
index.md.C'est normal la commande dans jeedom pre: It's normal the command in jeedom takes a different value depending on the physical button pressed
index.md.Le plus simple pour le voir et d'aller d: The easiest way to see it is to go to "Advanced configuration" (top right) then "Logs" (top right too) and press the buttons on the remote control to see the different values of the commands
index.md.timeout\" lors du démarrage du démon sur: timeout" when starting the daemon on an EZSP type key
index.md.Il est possible que la clef soit bloquée: It is possible that the key is blocked in bootloader mode, to get out of it you can go to the configuration of the plugin then click on "Update the firmware", select your type of key (on Smart/Atlas it is Elelabs/Popp ), in Zigbee port select your port and in firmware select "Correction bootloader
index.md.il ne faut faire cette manipulation que: this manipulation should only be done with Elelabs, Jeedom Atlas or Jeedom Smart type keys
index.md.Sur tout autre clef il faut contacter le: On any other key you must contact the manufacturer to give you the procedure
index.md.Cela peut venir d'un soucis avec la vers: This may come from a problem with the version of pip3, to correct it you have to go to the Jeedom configuration, OS / DB tab then launch the OS console and do
index.md.`sudo pip3 install --upgrade pip` puis r: `sudo pip3 install --upgrade pip` then restart the installation of dependencies
index.md.Si ca ne marche pas vous pouvez essayer: If that doesn't work you can try to do `sudo apt remove -y python3-openssl;sudo pip3 install --upgrade pip` and restart the installation of dependencies
